newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tajik premier says gold venture impasse solved.
newsitem.headline: Tajik premier says gold venture impasse solved.

text.p: Tajikistan Prime Minister Yakhyo Azimov said on Wednesday that an impasse over Zeravshan Gold Co, a mining joint venture between the Central Asian country and a Canadian firm, had been solved.

Nelson Gold Corp Ltd of Canada said last week that Zeravshan's mining and milling operations would be halted on Thursday due to an impasse with the Tajik government over gold gold refining and fiscal conditions.
Azimov and Nelson did not elaborate on the problems.
Nelson Gold's wholly owned unit, Commonwealth and British Minerals Ltd, holds a 49 percent stake in Zeravshan Gold and manages and operates the project.
The Tajikistan government holds the remaining stake.

"We had some problems," Azimov told Reuters Financial Television in Tokyo. "But a few days ago we talked with representatives of Nelson Gold and the IFC (International Finance Corp) and have already achieved a solution," he said.
IFC officials participated in the talks between the company and the government.
Nelson Gold, through Commonwealth and British Minerals, has invested $54 million in Zeravshan Gold.
Azimov is in Japan for a meeting on Central Asian nations.
